intro: Buena latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf plant, is a tropical species native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, broad, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its roots are fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
